channel.title: Errors
channel.description:
ok so i got a few errors while trying to put on a santa hat and turn into santa. here;s what they were.
client.java:14136: illegal start of expression public boolean wear (int wearID, int slot) { ^ client.java:32453 ';' expected } ^
so can anyone tell me how to fix this?

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ill have to post the code tomorrow.

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @Jaywalker Jaywalker
item.description:
@Jaywalker wrote:

“illegal start of expression” could mean that that function was put inside another function… which would be the case if my fix works. I’ve worked with java since you were in kindergarden… Lol (not to be mean or anything) but I’m fairly certian that my code will fix his problem.[br][size=1]Posted at: December 03, 2006, 11:13:24 PM[/size][hr]Zyle: make sure you closed your if statement for a new command with a }… If you didn’t, it will mess everything up (i.e. put all of your other command if…then statements inside of that first one… which would make them not work). Why don’t you post all the code you added + a line before and a line after

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

thats the thing i didnt put that there. wolf from project 16 did. all i tried to do was add another wear command. ok what he had was put on the zammy cape and turn into a zamorak mage (npc) what i tried to do was put on the santa hat and you turn into santa. and the second error, is the last line in the entire client.

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @samuraiblood2 samuraiblood2
item.description:
@samuraiblood2 wrote:

lol the tag got messed up -.-[br][size=1]Posted at: December 03, 2006, 11:04:11 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Jaywalker, post:4, topic:32046”]You most likely forgot a } at the end of your last function. Check on line for 14135 and see if there is a }… if so, add another one (sometimes they get lost in if statements) and see if that works. :).

Oh and from the looks of your last error, you’ll need a ; after it… must be something other than a function… hehe[/quote]uhh no the first error is he declared in the wrong spot the second error is probly because of the first one

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @Jaywalker Jaywalker
item.description:
@Jaywalker wrote:

You most likely forgot a } at the end of your last function. Check on line for 14135 and see if there is a }… if so, add another one (sometimes they get lost in if statements) and see if that works. :).

Oh and from the looks of your last error, you’ll need a ; after it… must be something other than a function… hehe

Read full topic
